column3: Strong concept ACK (https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/15894#discussion_r297326036).

The GUI never picked up the translation anyway, so there shouldn't be any user-facing changes other than in InitErrors (See the difference between "Bitcoin Core" and "Bitcoin Kern"):

![Screenshot from 2019-06-26 11-23-15](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6399679/60193070-048b3080-9805-11e9-972b-e854040ee860.png)

Edit: So I'd say to backport this change to 0.18.1
Concept ACK.
Concept ACK

<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#16224](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/16224.html) (gui: Bilingual GUI error messages by hebast
Concept ACK
Only the following instances are translated: `git grep '_(PACKA'`, but not the others.

> What would be the benefit of backporting this? Isn't it just a simplification to the code that wont have any user facing effects?\n\nThe only user-visible impact would be the InitErrors, I guess. It also reduces the workload of translators a bit by removing one(!) translation message. I don't think it's strictly necessary for backport but as there's really no added risk it doesn't hurt either.
Is the `qt: Run «make translate» in ./src/` commit (fab85208f678ba1be53bdb73a73ce3c5c937d448) a subject to review?\nIt seems it should be a part of the release process, right?
Yes, it is subject to review, since I changed the buildfile and reviewers will need to check that the new buildfile works as expected anyway (with or without my commit).
Is any reason to keep both `PACKAGE_NAME` and `COPYRIGHT_HOLDERS_SUBSTITUTION`?
I changed it so that `COPYRIGHT_HOLDERS_SUBSTITUTION` is also no longer translated, but I kept it for now. Maybe @luke-jr knows more why it is needed.

Generally, `COPYRIGHT_HOLDERS_SUBSTITUTION` should be "Bitcoin Core" even for software that isn't named "Bitcoin Core".\n\nRegarding the PR itself: Should we get input from translators who have been using translated package names for a long time?

> Regarding the PR itself: Should we get input from translators who have been using translated package names for a long time?\n\nIt can't hurt to ask people's input, but I'm not sure this makes much of a difference. E.g. are there any other occurences of "Bitcoin core" in the translated messages that shouldn't be translated?

> are there any other occurences of "Bitcoin core" in the translated messages that shouldn't be translated?

It doesn't look like it:

```
git grep 'Bitcoin Core' src/qt/locale/|grep '<source>'|grep -v '<source>Bitcoin Core</source>'|wc
      0       0       0

<!--a722867cd34abeea1fadc8d60700f111-->
Gitian builds for commit 7400135b7918df9c34206bead744c496e07b0e78 (master):
 * `66316632f25c471c92b762b1d01f2c1f...` [bitcoin-0.18.99-aarch64-linux-gnu-debug.tar.gz](https://drahtbot.space/gitian/bitcoin/bitcoin/7400135b7918df9c34206bead744c496e07b0e78/bitcoin-0.18.99-aarch64-linux-gnu-debug.tar.gz)
 * `c6072e273c53366e1cc83d9d59ce58fc...` [bitcoin-0.18.9
Is this still a candidate for backport? It's likely missed `v0.18.1` unless we have an rc2. But could still be pulled into the `v0.18` branch if wanted.
Bumped to 0.18.2. I've included this for backport in #16617.

nit:
```
const std::string copyright_devs = strprintf(_(COPYRIGHT_HOLDERS), COPYRIGHT_HOLDERS_SUBSTITUTION);
```
